author: prbuzz.com
title: Reports show cool tech once limited to sci-fi is now within reach of consumers
text:
The top gadgets in today’s market are already far beyond what the average person from the year 2000 would have thought could be possible in such a short time, but the cool tech of the very near future is even more like sci-fi than ever before as in recent reports on many online mobile technology news magazines.
While smartphones, tablets and other top gadgets are impressive , technology giants are delving into categories of wearable technology that could soon become quite commonplace and that might bring the Internet of Things (IoT) much closer than it ever has before. Everything from augmented reality glasses to smartwatches are making it seem as though “Star Trek” and “Back to the Future” might not have been as out-there as we previously believed.
Google Glass has already seen a beta generation tested among thousands of users. While that device was retired, it looks as though the company hasn’t given up on augmented reality glasses and that it is more than likely working on a new generation of devices that may even be able to display 3D holograms for the wearer.
Similarly, recent rumors swirling around Amazon have indicated that the online marketplace that has always had a love for cool tech, may now be working on its own augmented reality glasses to enhance the online experience of its shoppers and, quite certainly, to provide an entirely new way to shop at its marketplace. As mentioned by Julie Campbell, mobile technology reporter, “Amazon is getting into this augmented reality smartglasses industry at a time that it is still in its early infancy…” but then alludes to a product that might be already in early stages of saturation, “There are even those that have already come and gone”.
Addiction to smartphones and similar gadgets is already spreading across the country and around the globe as has been shown by the explosive growth of the backup external battery charger market . People simply can’t live without having their devices powered up and usable on any given day. With wearables evolving at a staggering rate, this trend of tech dependence and addiction is only likely to continue.
Moreover, it is also likely to completely change the face of marketing. Digital and mobile is already overtaking marketing strongholds such as newspapers and even television. As geolocation technology – with geo-targeting and geo-fencing – become increasingly commonplace, combining those techniques with upcoming sci-fi-like wearable technology such as smartglasses will open up a massive number of possibilities within this advertising revolution.
Major players and startups alike are banking on the popularity of smartwatches, augmented reality glasses and devices that haven’t yet moved beyond the prototype stage (such as tech that is actually implanted in the body). At this speed, the cool tech of the future will soon be the top gadgets of today.
